element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm calculates lacunarity statistics for a categorical raster layer. Lacunarity quantifies the spatial structure of categories in a raster layer, analyzing their shape and spatial configuration.
The algorithm uses a variable-size gliding box and analyzes statistical values of lacunarity across the raster layer for each size.

element.name: MAX_SIZE
element.text: The largest size of the gliding window. All sizes from 4 to this largest size are analyzed

element.name: RESULT_CHART
element.text: A chart showing how lacunarity varies with window size
